DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value that documents how far an endoscope is inserted into the upper GI lumen during an upper GI endoscopy procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Procedures of applying ENDOSCOPES for disease diagnosis and treatment. Endoscopy involves passing an optical instrument along either natural body pathways such as the digestive tract, or through keyhole incisions to examine the interior parts of the body. With advances in imaging, endoscope, and miniaturization of endosurgical equipment, surgery can be performed durging endoscopy.  The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (en-DAHS-ko-pee) The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The numeral or string of numerals used to identify the extent downward or inward a device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibres that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibres that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body.The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (eg biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.:The act of putting one thing into another.:Depth; extent downward or inward.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A device consisting of a tube containing flexible optic fibres that may be inserted into a body opening to allow a doctor to examine hollow organs inside the body.The result may be viewed on a video screen. It has diagnostic (eg biopsy) and therapeutic capabilities.
The act of putting one thing into another.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
